trans-unit.source: View your access and usage reports
trans-unit.target: View your access and usage reports

trans-unit.source: A topic that explains how to view access and usage reports to gain insight into the integrity and security of your organization’s directory.
trans-unit.target: A topic that explains how to view access and usage reports to gain insight into the integrity and security of your organization’s directory.

trans-unit.source: View your access and usage reports
trans-unit.target: View your access and usage reports

trans-unit.source: You can use Azure Active Directory's access and usage reports to gain visibility into the integrity and security of your organization’s directory.
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure Active Directory's access and usage reports to gain visibility into the integrity and security of your organization’s directory.

trans-unit.source: With this information, a directory admin can better determine where possible security risks may lie so that they can adequately plan to mitigate those risks.
trans-unit.target: With this information, a directory admin can better determine where possible security risks may lie so that they can adequately plan to mitigate those risks.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, reports are categorized in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, reports are categorized in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: Anomaly reports – Contain sign in events that we found to be anomalous.
trans-unit.target: Anomaly reports – Contain sign in events that we found to be anomalous.

trans-unit.source: Our goal is to make you aware of such activity and enable you to be able to make a determination about whether an event is suspicious.
trans-unit.target: Our goal is to make you aware of such activity and enable you to be able to make a determination about whether an event is suspicious.

trans-unit.source: Integrated Application reports – Provides insights into how cloud applications are being used in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Integrated Application reports – Provides insights into how cloud applications are being used in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory offers integration with thousands of cloud applications.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory offers integration with thousands of cloud applications.

trans-unit.source: Error reports – Indicate errors that may occur when provisioning accounts to external applications.
trans-unit.target: Error reports – Indicate errors that may occur when provisioning accounts to external applications.

trans-unit.source: User-specific reports – Display device/sign in activity data for a specific user.
trans-unit.target: User-specific reports – Display device/sign in activity data for a specific user.

trans-unit.source: Activity logs – Contain a record of all audited events within the last 24 hours, last 7 days, or last 30 days, as well as group activity changes, and password reset and registration activity.
trans-unit.target: Activity logs – Contain a record of all audited events within the last 24 hours, last 7 days, or last 30 days, as well as group activity changes, and password reset and registration activity.

trans-unit.source: Some advanced anomaly and resource usage reports are only available when you enable [Azure Active Directory Premium](active-directory-get-started-premium.md).
trans-unit.target: Some advanced anomaly and resource usage reports are only available when you enable [Azure Active Directory Premium](active-directory-get-started-premium.md).

trans-unit.source: Advanced reports help you improve access security, respond to potential threats and get access to analytics on device access and application usage.
trans-unit.target: Advanced reports help you improve access security, respond to potential threats and get access to analytics on device access and application usage.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Premium and Basic editions are available for customers in China using the worldwide instance of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Premium and Basic editions are available for customers in China using the worldwide instance of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Premium and Basic editions are not currently supported in the Microsoft Azure service operated by 21Vianet in China.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Premium and Basic editions are not currently supported in the Microsoft Azure service operated by 21Vianet in China.

trans-unit.source: For more information, contact us at the [Azure Active Directory Forum](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/169401-azure-active-directory).
trans-unit.target: For more information, contact us at the [Azure Active Directory Forum](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/169401-azure-active-directory).

trans-unit.source: May indicate an attempt to sign in without being traced.
trans-unit.target: May indicate an attempt to sign in without being traced.

trans-unit.source: May indicate a successful brute force attack.
trans-unit.target: May indicate a successful brute force attack.

trans-unit.source: May indicate that multiple users are signing in with the same account.
trans-unit.target: May indicate that multiple users are signing in with the same account.

trans-unit.source: Sign ins from IP addresses with suspicious activity
trans-unit.target: Sign ins from IP addresses with suspicious activity

trans-unit.source: May indicate a successful sign in after a sustained intrusion attempt.
trans-unit.target: May indicate a successful sign in after a sustained intrusion attempt.

trans-unit.source: Sign ins from possibly infected devices
trans-unit.target: Sign ins from possibly infected devices

trans-unit.source: May indicate an attempt to sign in from possibly infected devices.
trans-unit.target: May indicate an attempt to sign in from possibly infected devices.

trans-unit.source: May indicate events anomalous to users’ sign in patterns.
trans-unit.target: May indicate events anomalous to users’ sign in patterns.

trans-unit.source: Users with anomalous sign in activity
trans-unit.target: Users with anomalous sign in activity

trans-unit.source: Indicates users whose accounts may have been compromised.
trans-unit.target: Indicates users whose accounts may have been compromised.

trans-unit.source: Provides a detailed view of password resets that occur in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Provides a detailed view of password resets that occur in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Provides a detailed view of password reset registrations that occur in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Provides a detailed view of password reset registrations that occur in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Provides an activity log to all group self service activity in your directory
trans-unit.target: Provides an activity log to all group self service activity in your directory

trans-unit.source: Provides a usage summary for all SaaS applications integrated with your directory.
trans-unit.target: Provides a usage summary for all SaaS applications integrated with your directory.

trans-unit.source: Provides a history of attempts to provision accounts to external applications.
trans-unit.target: Provides a history of attempts to provision accounts to external applications.

trans-unit.source: Provides a detailed overview of automatic password rollover status of SaaS applications.
trans-unit.target: Provides a detailed overview of automatic password rollover status of SaaS applications.

trans-unit.source: Indicates an impact to users’ access to external applications.
trans-unit.target: Indicates an impact to users’ access to external applications.

trans-unit.source: Provides a summary for Rights Management usage
trans-unit.target: Provides a summary for Rights Management usage

trans-unit.source: Lists top 1000 active users who accessed RMS-protected files
trans-unit.target: Lists top 1000 active users who accessed RMS-protected files

trans-unit.source: Lists devices used for accessing RMS-protected files
trans-unit.target: Lists devices used for accessing RMS-protected files

trans-unit.source: Provides usage of RMS enabled applications
trans-unit.target: Provides usage of RMS enabled applications

trans-unit.source: Sign ins from IP addresses with suspicious activity
trans-unit.target: Sign ins from IP addresses with suspicious activity

trans-unit.source: Sign ins from possibly infected devices
trans-unit.target: Sign ins from possibly infected devices

trans-unit.source: Users with anomalous sign in activity
trans-unit.target: Users with anomalous sign in activity

trans-unit.source: The anomalous sign in activity reports flag suspicious sign in activity to Office365, Azure Management Portal, Azure AD Access Panel, Sharepoint Online, Dynamics CRM Online, and other Microsoft online services.
trans-unit.target: The anomalous sign in activity reports flag suspicious sign in activity to Office365, Azure Management Portal, Azure AD Access Panel, Sharepoint Online, Dynamics CRM Online, and other Microsoft online services.

trans-unit.source: All of these reports, except the "Sign ins after multiple failures" report, also flag suspicious federated sign ins to the aforementioned services, regardless of the federation provider.
trans-unit.target: All of these reports, except the "Sign ins after multiple failures" report, also flag suspicious federated sign ins to the aforementioned services, regardless of the federation provider.

trans-unit.source: [Sign ins from IP addresses with suspicious activity](active-directory-reporting-sign-ins-from-ip-addresses-with-suspicious-activity.md).
trans-unit.target: [Sign ins from IP addresses with suspicious activity](active-directory-reporting-sign-ins-from-ip-addresses-with-suspicious-activity.md).

trans-unit.source: Shows a record of all audited events within the last 24 hours, last 7 days, or last 30 days.
trans-unit.target: Shows a record of all audited events within the last 24 hours, last 7 days, or last 30 days.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Active Directory Audit Report Events](active-directory-reporting-audit-events.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Active Directory Audit Report Events](active-directory-reporting-audit-events.md)

trans-unit.source: Shows all password reset attempts that have occurred in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Shows all password reset attempts that have occurred in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Shows all password reset registrations that have occurred in your organization
trans-unit.target: Shows all password reset registrations that have occurred in your organization

trans-unit.source: Shows all activity for the self-service managed groups in your directory.
trans-unit.target: Shows all activity for the self-service managed groups in your directory.

trans-unit.source: Use this report when you want to see usage for all the SaaS applications in your directory.
trans-unit.target: Use this report when you want to see usage for all the SaaS applications in your directory.

trans-unit.source: This report is based on the number of times users have clicked on the application in the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: This report is based on the number of times users have clicked on the application in the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: Use this report when you want to see how much a specific SaaS application is being used.
trans-unit.target: Use this report when you want to see how much a specific SaaS application is being used.

trans-unit.source: This report is based on the number of times users have clicked on the application in the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: This report is based on the number of times users have clicked on the application in the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: This report indicates cumulative sign ins to the application by users in your organization, over a selected time interval.
trans-unit.target: This report indicates cumulative sign ins to the application by users in your organization, over a selected time interval.

trans-unit.source: The chart on the dashboard page will help you identify trends for all usage of that application.
trans-unit.target: The chart on the dashboard page will help you identify trends for all usage of that application.

trans-unit.source: Use this to monitor errors that occur during the synchronization of accounts from SaaS applications to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Use this to monitor errors that occur during the synchronization of accounts from SaaS applications to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Use this report when you want to see the IP address and geographical location of devices that a specific user has used to access Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Use this report when you want to see the IP address and geographical location of devices that a specific user has used to access Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Shows the sign in activity for a user.
trans-unit.target: Shows the sign in activity for a user.

trans-unit.source: The report includes information like the application signed into, device used, IP address, and location.
trans-unit.target: The report includes information like the application signed into, device used, IP address, and location.

trans-unit.source: We do not collect the history for users that sign in with a Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: We do not collect the history for users that sign in with a Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: Sign in events included in the User Activity report
trans-unit.target: Sign in events included in the User Activity report

trans-unit.source: Only certain types of sign in events will appear in the User Activity report.
trans-unit.target: Only certain types of sign in events will appear in the User Activity report.

trans-unit.source: Sign ins to the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign ins to the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/)

trans-unit.source: Sign ins to the [Microsoft Azure Portal](http://portal.azure.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign ins to the [Microsoft Azure Portal](http://portal.azure.com/)

trans-unit.source: Sign ins to a native application, like Outlook (see exception below)
trans-unit.target: Sign ins to a native application, like Outlook (see exception below)

trans-unit.source: Sign ins to a federated/provisioned app through the Access Panel, like Salesforce
trans-unit.target: Sign ins to a federated/provisioned app through the Access Panel, like Salesforce

trans-unit.source: Sign ins to a password-based app through the Access Panel, like Twitter
trans-unit.target: Sign ins to a password-based app through the Access Panel, like Twitter

trans-unit.source: Sign ins to a custom business app that has been added to the directory
trans-unit.target: Sign ins to a custom business app that has been added to the directory

trans-unit.source: Sign ins to an Azure AD Application Proxy app that has been added to the directory
trans-unit.target: Sign ins to an Azure AD Application Proxy app that has been added to the directory

trans-unit.source: Note: To reduce the amount of noise in this report, sign ins to the [Lync/Skype for Business](http://products.office.com/en-us/skype-for-business/online-meetings) native app and by the [Microsoft Online Services Sign-In Assistant](http://community.office365.com/en-us/w/sso/534.aspx) are not shown.
trans-unit.target: Note: To reduce the amount of noise in this report, sign ins to the [Lync/Skype for Business](http://products.office.com/en-us/skype-for-business/online-meetings) native app and by the [Microsoft Online Services Sign-In Assistant](http://community.office365.com/en-us/w/sso/534.aspx) are not shown.

trans-unit.source: Things to consider if you suspect security breach
trans-unit.target: Things to consider if you suspect security breach

trans-unit.source: If you suspect that a user account may be compromised or any kind of suspicious user activity that may lead to a security breach of your directory data in the cloud, you may want to consider one or more of the following actions:
trans-unit.target: If you suspect that a user account may be compromised or any kind of suspicious user activity that may lead to a security breach of your directory data in the cloud, you may want to consider one or more of the following actions:

trans-unit.source: Contact the user to verify the activity
trans-unit.target: Contact the user to verify the activity

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, click **Active Directory**, click the name of your organization’s directory, and then click **Reports**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, click **Active Directory**, click the name of your organization’s directory, and then click **Reports**.

trans-unit.source: On the Reports page, click the report you want to view and/or download.
trans-unit.target: On the Reports page, click the report you want to view and/or download.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If this is the first time you have used the reporting feature of Azure Active Directory, you will see a message to Opt In.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If this is the first time you have used the reporting feature of Azure Active Directory, you will see a message to Opt In.

trans-unit.source: If you agree, click the check mark icon to continue.
trans-unit.target: If you agree, click the check mark icon to continue.

trans-unit.source: Click the drop-down menu next to Interval, and then select one of the following time ranges that should be used when generating this report:
trans-unit.target: Click the drop-down menu next to Interval, and then select one of the following time ranges that should be used when generating this report:

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark icon to run the report.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark icon to run the report.

trans-unit.source: Up to 1000 events will be shown in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Up to 1000 events will be shown in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: If applicable, click **Download** to download the report to a compressed file in Comma Separated Values (CSV) format for offline viewing or archiving purposes.
trans-unit.target: If applicable, click **Download** to download the report to a compressed file in Comma Separated Values (CSV) format for offline viewing or archiving purposes.

trans-unit.source: Up to 75,000 events will be included in the downloaded file.
trans-unit.target: Up to 75,000 events will be included in the downloaded file.

trans-unit.source: If you are viewing any anomaly reports, you may notice that you can ignore various events that show up in related reports.
trans-unit.target: If you are viewing any anomaly reports, you may notice that you can ignore various events that show up in related reports.

trans-unit.source: To ignore an event, simply highlight the event in the report and then click **Ignore**.
trans-unit.target: To ignore an event, simply highlight the event in the report and then click **Ignore**.

trans-unit.source: The **Ignore** button will permanently remove the highlighted event from the report and can only be used by licensed global admins.
trans-unit.target: The **Ignore** button will permanently remove the highlighted event from the report and can only be used by licensed global admins.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Azure AD's reporting notifications, check out [Azure Active Directory Reporting Notifications](active-directory-reporting-notifications.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Azure AD's reporting notifications, check out [Azure Active Directory Reporting Notifications](active-directory-reporting-notifications.md).

trans-unit.target: Getting started with Azure Active Directory Premium

trans-unit.target: Add company branding to your Sign In and Access Panel pages
